intro: Pilosella dublitzkii, commonly known as the Dublitzki's goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets. Pilosella dublitzkii typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils.
